title: Epic: Transactional email foundations
description: Track T-24 deliverables: provider selection, email helper, order confirmation triggers, password reset hook-up, and the verification run.

title: T-24.1 - Choose email provider
description: Select a transactional email provider (Resend/Brevo/etc.), define sandbox/prod env vars, and document the decision under docs/.

title: T-24.2 - Build lib/email.ts
description: Introduce lib/email.ts with typed helpers (sendOrderConfirmation, sendPasswordReset, etc.) that wrap the chosen provider.

title: T-24.3 - Trigger order confirmation emails
description: Invoke sendOrderConfirmation after Stripe webhook paid status and any manual paid transitions, ensuring idempotency.

title: T-24.4 - Password reset email flow
description: Wire password reset pages/routes to sendPasswordReset, handling token lifecycle securely.

title: T-24.5 - Transactional email QA
description: Send a mock order confirmation and password reset to real test inboxes, reviewing subject/copy/links/branding.

title: Epic: Checkout QA & guest checkout
description: Track the 2025-12-01 plan items for checkout QA runs (T-03.2) and guest checkout implementation (T-04), spanning schema, UI, logic and verification.

title: T-03.2a - Checkout QA with registered user
description: Run the logged-in checkout flow end to end (cart → checkout → shipping selection → payment → redirect) and validate resulting order/payment rows. Capture notes for one successful Stripe test card run and one intentionally declined card.

title: T-03.2b - Checkout QA in mock mode
description: Exercise the checkout flow with Supabase disabled/mock data and document what succeeds vs what is unavailable in demo mode so stakeholders understand limitations.

title: T-04.1 - Orders schema for guest checkout
description: Extend scripts/00-schema.sql with optional guest fields (email, name, contact) on orders plus matching RLS updates so guest checkouts remain secure.

title: T-04.2 - Checkout UI guest option
description: Add a 'continue as guest' flow in app/checkout/page.tsx and the order summary UI that captures guest email/basic info and forwards it to order/payment endpoints.

title: T-04.3 - Order creation handles guests
description: Update the lib/db.ts order creation helper so guest checkouts populate the new guest fields while authenticated users keep the current path.
notes: Guest order creation logic wired through helpers/UI/API; ready for QA bead.

title: T-04.4 - Guest checkout end-to-end QA
description: Run a Stripe test guest order after guest UI + backend land, capture screenshots/payload snippets, and verify order/payment/email records.

title: Epic: Full-text search backend
description: Own T-07/T-08 backend work: Postgres search index, typed helper, suggestions API design/build and coverage tests.

title: T-07.1 - Search index design
description: Document which product fields (name, OEM, brand, category, keywords) go into the Postgres tsvector and their weights.

title: T-07.2 - Postgres full-text indexes
description: Add tsvector generation + GIN index migration (scripts/00-schema.sql or new migration) without regressing existing indexes.

title: T-07.3 - Typed search helper
description: Implement a lib/db.ts searchProducts helper returning products + relevance score, consuming the new index.

title: T-08.1 - Search suggestions API design
description: Plan how /api/search/suggest will group suggestions (queries, OEM matches, categories) and capture logging requirements.

title: T-08.2 - Implement /api/search/suggest
description: Build the API route aggregating term suggestions, OEM hits and category prompts with structured JSON output.
notes: Implemented GET /api/search/suggest with Supabase + mock fallback and typed response models.

title: T-08.3 - Suggestions API tests
description: Write coverage for /api/search/suggest covering empty/short/long queries and fallback for unknown OEMs.
notes: Added scripts/test-search-suggest.ts + npm run test:search covering key scenarios

title: Epic: Order lifecycle + admin orders UI
description: Coordinate T-05 and T-06 roadmap work: status model, helpers, secured API surface plus the admin list/detail experience and supporting QA.

title: T-05.1 - Order status model & doc
description: Finalize the order status states (pending/paid/processing/shipped/cancelled/refunded) and capture the state diagram in docs/ so future work has a reference.
notes: Added docs/order-status-model.md with glossary, transitions, and enforcement checklist.

title: T-05.2 - Order status helpers
description: Add typed helpers in lib/db.ts to update order status in sync with order_payments, exposing e.g. updateOrderStatus(orderId, newStatus, meta).
notes: Added status transition helpers + validation utilities in lib/db.ts

title: T-05.3 - PATCH /api/orders/[id]/status
description: Create a secured route for status updates that enforces auth + RLS and calls the new helpers; only privileged roles can change order status.
notes: Added PATCH /api/orders/[id]/status route using new helpers and admin auth.

title: T-05.4 - Status helper/API tests
description: Add unit/integration coverage for the order status helper and PATCH route (happy path plus unauthorized/invalid transitions).

title: T-06.1 - Admin orders list
description: Build /admin/orders with table columns (order ID, date, customer, total, status, payment status) and filters for status + date.

title: T-06.2 - Admin order detail view
description: Implement an order detail surface with line items, shipping/tax breakdown, status dropdown and payment event timeline.

title: T-06.3 - Admin status update wiring
description: Wire the admin UI to call PATCH /api/orders/[id]/status with optimistic updates and surfaced errors.

title: T-06.4 - Admin order QA
description: QA three admin flows (pending→paid, paid→shipped, invalid shipped→cancelled) and document expected/blocked behaviors.

title: Epic: Header search autocomplete UI
description: Deliver the T-09 UI/UX pieces: specify behavior, build the autocomplete component, integrate it into the header and QA keyboard/mobile flows.

title: T-09.1 - Autocomplete UX spec
description: Define the UX for the header autocomplete (result groups, icons, keyboard nav, mobile behavior) in md or Figma link.

title: T-09.2 - Build search autocomplete component
description: Create components/search-autocomplete.tsx with debounced calls to /api/search/suggest plus loading/empty states and mobile-friendly UX.

title: T-09.3 - Integrate autocomplete into header
description: Replace/extend the existing header search with the new autocomplete, ensuring ARIA compliance on desktop/mobile.

title: T-09.4 - Autocomplete UX QA
description: Exercise OEM/brand/error queries on desktop/mobile, verify keyboard shortcuts, highlight issues for next polish round.
